lines.text:
[Sowerberry has handed Claypoole mourning clothes, instructing him to give them to Oliver]
But these are funeral clothes! You promised me the job of silent mourner!
I never did. Besides, he has a much better face for it than you. He looks so sad.

[weeping after Oliver's mother has died]
She never said a word... her shoes was worn to pieces.

[deciding on Oliver's name]
The last was 'S'... Swubble. This is 'T'. I name him Twist... Oliver Twist.

[Fagin has just called Bill a drunk]
Don't you call ME names, you dirty Jew!

[Brownlow has told Bumble he intends to bring charges against him for his mistreatment of Oliver and the other orphans]
If that's the law, then the law is an ass!

[Bill's dog runs off after he has killed Nancy; he starts after the dog, stumbling drunk]
Come back here, you bloody dog!

[after Sowerberry separates Oliver and Noah from fighting]
He said bad things about my mum.
She's everything he says she is and worse! You're going back! You hear me, boy? You're going back!

[as he has a gun pressed against the underside of Oliver's chin and aimed upwards]
You see this, boy?

[holding out his empty bowl]
Please sir, I want some more.

[in disbelief]
He wants some more!
Do you live here, Mr. Claypoole?

[menacingly]
No, I got a mother and father! I ain't some little foundling off the street!

[a constable and a crowd has assembled outside of Fagin's house, he comes out]
Yes, constable? What can I do for you?
You're Fagin, right?
That's right.
Come on, then!
[leads him away]
Filthy Jew!
Who calls me that?
I do!
[throws rock in Fagin's face, it hits him in the cheek and mouth]

[madly]
Here! You want the other cheek? I know your faces! Yes! We've done business together! If you need money, I'm the clever Jew! If you don't know the answers, I'm the wise Jew! If you need my help, I'm the kind Jew! Yeah, you can all go to blazes! YOU SICKEN ME!

[watching from a distance]
Good riddance to him.
